text:
<@U681ELA87>
```Arrow.write("/tmp/data.arrow", DataFrame(days=[Day(i) for i in 1:1:10]))
run(`Rscript -e "library(arrow); df = read_feather('/tmp/data.arrow')"`);

Error in Table__to_dataframe(x, use_threads = option_use_threads()) : 
  cannot handle Array of type 
Calls: read_feather ... as.data.frame -> as.data.frame.Table -> Table__to_dataframe
Execution halted
ERROR: failed process: Process(`Rscript -e "library(arrow); df = read_feather('/tmp/data.arrow')"`, ProcessExited(1)) [1]```
raises an error in R. would that be an R `arrow` bug?

text: It doesn’t say what the type is that it can’t handle? I think for Day we serial zen it as a Duration. I’ll have to double check when I’m back at a computer. I wouldn’t be surprised if R didn’t handle that though.
